resources.string: Please put your headphone\'s right side close to your phone\'s mic and then you can click the start to start the measurement.\n\nIf it\'s your first time using the program, there are some guides to you, just slide to the right
Good! We have got the right side data, now put your headphone\'s left side close to your phone\'s mic and click the continue button to continue

The chart shows the max and min dBHL(0 ~ 70) of frequency(0 ~ 8000) data of your headphone.\n\nYou can click the close button at top left to close the hint page to see the real chart and touch the data area at top to let the hint page back

Excellent! We have finish the measurement, you can click the close button to see what we have got.\n\nYou can click the add button below to save the data or just click the start button below to start a new measurement
If you want to stop the measurement click the stop button below, or just click the back button at top bar
ERROR: left or right data not get
You can adjust what your mic\'s offset, default is +10

Please put on your headphone and click the start button below to select your headphone data and start the audiometry\n\nIf it\'s your first time using the program, there are some guides to you, just slide to the right
When you start the audiometry, there will be 3 buttons at bottom ( unheard, replay, heard)

The program will play a tone, when the tone is playing, the replay button will rotating, and the tone\'s data will be show in the data area at top\n\nIf you heard the tone, click the heard button, if not, click the unheard button, if not sure, click the replay button to replay the tone
The Audiometry is finish, you can click the close button to see the chart, and this is your result
Right: average (%.1f dBHL) Damage Level (%s)\n\nLeft: average (%.1f dBHL) Damage Level (%s)
If you want to start a new audiometry, click the button below

The chart will show the min dBHL you can hear of the specified frequency, like the chart below. But sometimes the headphone data we get is not complete, so there will be some different.

The Rule of add point is:
1.You can hear the tone when the volume is rising or You can not hear the tone when the volume is falling.
2.Min data of headphone under 25 dBHL, and you can still hear the tone
3.Max data of headphone is 70 and you can not hear when the dBHL is 70.
The test will help find your hearing loss level, make sure you are in are quiet place and then click the button below
The test will test your word recognition ability, make sure you are in are quiet place and then click the button below

Please adjust your volume to that you can hear the sound clearly, you can click the 
"Say Hello"
 button to test the sound, if you sure that your volume is enough but still can not hear anything, click the set button below to set your TTS engine to CHINESE

If you are ready, click the start button below to start the test
It seems that your device\'s TTS engine not support CHINESE, click the button below to set your TTS engine, if all your TTS engine is not support CHINESE, click the link below to get the TTS engine
You have finished the test, If you want to start a new test click the button below, and your score is
The big top number shows your score
The gery data area, shows what you say
When you are ready for next, click the next button
When your answer is right, there will show a green hint circle
When your answer is wrong, there will show a red hint circle, and you will have a opportunity to refute
The red hint will show 1.5 seconds, in this time, you can click the hint, and there will show 4 choices, chose the right one, that you can also get the score
Please select your headphone data of the following
